props.summary:
### Summary of Core Topics, Concepts, Principles, and Equations

#### 1. **Matrix Inverses and Properties**
- **Inverse of a Matrix**: For a matrix \( A \), the inverse \( A^{-1} \) satisfies \( A A^{-1} = I \).
- **Properties**: Rank, trace, and determinant are invariant under similarity transformations.
- **Equations**:
  - \( A^{-1} = \frac{1}{\det(A)} \text{adj}(A) \)
  - \( \text{rank}(A) = \text{rank}(A^{-1}) \)
  - \( \text{trace}(A) = \text{trace}(A^{-1}) \)
  - \( \det(A) = \det(A^{-1}) \)

#### 2. **Linear Transformations**
- **Definition**: A linear transformation \( T: \mathbb{R}^n \to \mathbb{R}^m \) satisfies \( T(ax + by) = aT(x) + bT(y) \).
- **Matrix Representation**: A linear transformation can be represented by a matrix \( M \) such that \( T(x) = Mx \).
- **Properties**: Rank, nullity, and determinant are key properties.
- **Equations**:
  - \( \text{rank}(T) = \text{rank}(M) \)
  - \( \text{nullity}(T) = n - \text{rank}(T) \)
  - \( \det(T) = \det(M) \)

#### 3. **Null Space and Rank**
- **Null Space**: The set of all vectors \( x \) such that \( Ax = 0 \).
- **Rank**: The dimension of the column space of \( A \).
- **Equations**:
  - \( \text{nullity}(A) = n - \text{rank}(A) \)
  - \( \text{rank}(A) \leq \min(m, n) \)

#### 4. **Orthogonal Transformations**
- **Definition**: A linear transformation \( T \) is orthogonal if it preserves the inner product, i.e., \( \langle T(x), T(y) \rangle = \langle x, y \rangle \).
- **Properties**: Orthogonal transformations preserve lengths and angles.
- **Equations**:
  - \( ||T(x)|| = ||x|| \)
  - \( \det(Q) = \pm 1 \) for an orthogonal matrix \( Q \)

#### 5. **Projection and Gram-Schmidt Process**
- **Projection**: The projection of a vector \( u \) onto a vector \( v \) is given by \( \text{proj}_v u = \frac{\langle u, v \rangle}{\langle v, v \rangle} v \).
- **Gram-Schmidt Process**: A method for orthonormalizing a set of vectors.
- **Equations**:
  - \( \text{proj}_v u = \frac{u \cdot v}{v \cdot v} v \)
  - Gram-Schmidt: \( v_1 = u_1 \), \( v_2 = u_2 - \text{proj}_{v_1} u_2 \), etc.

#### 6. **Affine Spaces**
- **Definition**: An affine space is a set of points that can be expressed as \( v + W \), where \( v \) is a vector and \( W \) is a subspace.
- **Properties**: Affine spaces are translations of subspaces.
- **Equations**:
  - \( L = \{ v + w \mid w \in W \} \)

### Knowledge Graph 

```mermaid
graph TD;
    A[Matrix Inverses] -->|Properties| B[Rank]
    A -->|Properties| C[Trace]
    A -->|Properties| D[Determinant]
    B -->|Equation| E[nullity(A) = n - rank(A)]
    C -->|Equation| F[trace(A) = trace(A^{-1})]
    D -->|Equation| G[det(A) = det(A^{-1})]

    H[Linear Transformations] -->|Representation| I[Matrix]
    H -->|Properties| J[Rank]
    H -->|Properties| K[Nullity]
    H -->|Properties| L[Determinant]
    I -->|Equation| M[T(x) = Mx]
    J -->|Equation| N[rank(T) = rank(M)]
    K -->|Equation| O[nullity(T) = n - rank(T)]
    L -->|Equation| P[det(T) = det(M)]

    Q[Null Space and Rank] -->|Definition| R[Null Space]
    Q -->|Definition| S[Rank]
    R -->|Equation| T[nullity(A) = n - rank(A)]
    S -->|Equation| U[rank(A) ≤ min(m, n)]

    V[Orthogonal Transformations] -->|Definition| W[Inner Product]
    V -->|Properties| X[Lengths and Angles]
    W -->|Equation| Y[⟨T(x), T(y)⟩ = ⟨x, y⟩]
    X -->|Equation| Z[||T(x)|| = ||x||]

    AA[Projection] -->|Definition| AB[Projection Formula]
    AA -->|Process| AC[Gram-Schmidt]
    AB -->|Equation| AD[proj_v u = (u · v)/(v · v) v]
    AC -->|Equation| AE[v_1 = u_1, v_2 = u_2 - proj_{v_1} u_2]

    AF[Affine Spaces] -->|Definition| AG[Affine Space]
    AF -->|Properties| AH[Translation of Subspaces]
    AG -->|Equation| AI[L = {v + w | w ∈ W}]
```

```mermaid
    C -->|Equation| F[trace(A) = trace(A^{-1})]
    D -->|Equation| G[det(A) = det(A^{-1})]

    H[Linear Transformations] -->|Representation| I[Matrix]
    H -->|Properties| J[Rank]
    H -->|Properties| K[Nullity]
    H -->|Properties| L[Determinant]
    I -->|Equation| M[T(x) = Mx]
    J -->|Equation| N[rank(T) = rank(M)]
    K -->|Equation| O[nullity(T) = n - rank(T)]
    L -->|Equation| P[det(T) = det(M)]
```

```mermaid
graph TD;
    Q[Null Space and Rank] -->|Definition| R[Null Space]
    Q -->|Definition| S[Rank]
    R -->|Equation| T[nullity(A) = n - rank(A)]
    S -->|Equation| U[rank(A) ≤ min(m, n)]

    V[Orthogonal Transformations] -->|Definition| W[Inner Product]
    V -->|Properties| X[Lengths and Angles]
    W -->|Equation| Y[⟨T(x), T(y)⟩ = ⟨x, y⟩]
    X -->|Equation| Z[||T(x)|| = ||x||]

    AA[Projection] -->|Definition| AB[Projection Formula]
    AA -->|Process| AC[Gram-Schmidt]
    AB -->|Equation| AD[proj_v u = (u · v)/(v · v) v]
    AC -->|Equation| AE[v_1 = u_1, v_2 = u_2 - proj_{v_1} u_2]

    AF[Affine Spaces] -->|Definition| AG[Affine Space]

    AG -->|Equation| AI[L = {v + w | w ∈ W}]
```
